title: nese lunar-eclipse records date to about 1200 B.C.; solar-eclipse records to about 720 B.C.; astronomical records, including records of supernovae, novae, comets, meteors, and aurorae, to about 200 B.C. One of the mysteries of the historical record is the apparent absence of European or Middle Eastern records

title: The basic equation governing the behavior of the calorimeter is ∆T = EX/C, where ∆T is the temperature change, EX is the energy of the absorbed X ray, and C is the heat capacity of the absorbing material.
